t: Proverbs 7
The Wiles of the Harlot
My*pn son, keep my words And*ln treasure my commandments within you.
Keep*ln my commandments and live, And*ln my teaching as the apple of your eye.
Bind*ln them on your fingers; Write*ln them on the tablet of your heart.
Say*ln to wisdom, “You are my sister,” And*ln call understanding your*i intimate friend;
That*ln they may keep you from an adulteress, From*ln the foreigner who flatters with her words.
For*ln at the window of my house I*ln looked out through my lattice,
And*ln I saw among the naive, And*iln discerned among the youths A*ln young man lacking sense,
Passing*ln through the street near her corner; And*ln he takes the way to her house,
In*ln the twilight, in the evening, In*ln the middle of the night and in*i the darkness.
And*ln behold, a woman comes*i to meet him, Dressed*ln as a harlot and cunning of heart.
She*ln is boisterous and rebellious, Her*ln feet do not remain at home;
She*iln is*i now in the streets, now in the squares, And*ln lurks by every corner.
So*ln she seizes him and kisses him And*ln with a brazen face she says to him:
“I*ln was due to offer peace offerings; Today*ln I have paid my vows.
Therefore*ln I have come out to meet you, To*ln seek your presence earnestly, and I have found you.
I*ln have spread my couch with coverings, With*ln colored linens of Egypt.
I*ln have sprinkled my bed With*ln myrrh, aloes and cinnamon.
Come,*ln let us drink our fill of love until morning; Let*ln us delight ourselves with caresses.
For*ln my husband is not at home, He*ln has gone on a long journey;
He*ln has taken a bag of money with him, At*ln the full moon he will come home.”
With*ln her many persuasions she entices him; With*ln her flattering lips she seduces him.
Suddenly*ln he follows her As*ln an ox goes to the slaughter, Or*ln as one*i in*i fetters to the discipline of a fool,
Until*ln an arrow pierces through his liver; As*ln a bird hastens to the snare, So*ln he does not know that it will*i cost*i him*i his life.
Now*ln therefore, my*i sons, listen to me, And*ln pay attention to the words of my mouth.
Do*ln not let your heart turn aside to her ways, Do*ln not stray into her paths.
For*ln many are the victims she has cast down, And*ln numerous are all her slain.
Her*ln house is the way to Sheol, Descending*ln to the chambers of death.
